AllyAdvice: Storing a stun for use with her ultimate can turn the tide of a team fight.
EnemyAdvice: Annie's summoned bear, Tibbers, burns opposing units around himself. Try to keep your distance from him after he's been summoned.

AllyAdvice: Striking killing blows on minions with Disintegrate enables Annie to farm extremely well early in the game.
EnemyAdvice: Summoner Smite can be used to help take down Tibbers.

AllyAdvice: Molten Shield is a good spell to cast to work up to Annie's stun, so sometimes it's beneficial to grab at least 1 rank in it early.
EnemyAdvice: Keep an eye out for a white, swirling power around Annie. It means she's ready to unleash her stun.

AllyAdvice: Olaf can combine Berserker Rage, Vicious Strikes, and Ragnarok at low life to become deceptively strong.
EnemyAdvice: Olaf becomes more dangerous the lower life he is. Save your disables to finish him off.

AllyAdvice: The bonus healing granted by Vicious Strikes amplifies your Life Steal from all sources as well as heals from allies.
EnemyAdvice: Preventing Olaf from reaching his axe will minimize the amount of harassment he can cause in the laning phase.
Olaf has reduced defenses from damage during Ragnarok, despite being immune to disables. If you can't escape from Olaf during Ragnarok, try focusing your damage on him with your teammates.

AllyAdvice: You can release Shield of Durand even while crowd controlled.
EnemyAdvice: Galio moves slower when he is charging Shield of Durand.

AllyAdvice: You can use the minimap ally icons to cast Hero's Entrance.
EnemyAdvice: Hero's Entrance can be interrupted before Galio jumps into the air.

AllyAdvice: You can use the step back from Justice Punch to dodge enemy spells.
EnemyAdvice: Galio cannot traverse walls with Justice Punch.

AllyAdvice: Coordinate with your allies for the best time to use Destiny to ambush enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Focus on dodging Wild Cards early when your champion doesn't have the hit points to afford getting hit.

AllyAdvice: Stealth characters often escape a battle with very low hit points. Take advantage of Destiny's ability to reveal stealthed units to finish them off.
EnemyAdvice: If you have low Health, use Destiny as an indicator to run to safety. It will give you a head start in escaping any possible ganks.

AllyAdvice: Twisted Fate is viable as an Attack Damage or Ability Power character, letting him fit on many different team compositions.
Xin Zhao is a great initiator to combat. Lead the front to start a fight and use your ultimate to do the most damage possible.
EnemyAdvice: Xin Zhao is a powerful initiator with both his charge and ultimate dealing damage to all units around him. Try having your team stay spread out until he's used his ultimate.

AllyAdvice: Try to position yourself so your ultimate's knockback is most effective.
EnemyAdvice: Xin Zhao relies heavily on his Three Talon Strikes for damage and cooldown resets, so preventing him from finishing his combo will have a dramatic effect.

AllyAdvice: Pay attention to your individual leg's cooldowns, as they make for a signficiant portion of your damage
EnemyAdvice: Urgot relies heavily on blasting opponents with his legs, which have their own cooldowns and only detonate when he attacks in the direction they are facing. Avoid getting hit by multiple.

AllyAdvice: Land Corrosive Charge or Disdain to lock on to target's with Purge - a great way to trigger multiple legs in rapid succession.
EnemyAdvice: Urgot can deal and absorb tremendous amounts of damage with Purge, but slows himself while firing.

AllyAdvice: Save Fear Beyond Death for opponents you know are already too weak to survive. It's especially good for picking off fleeing foes.
EnemyAdvice: If you are struck by Fear Beyond Death, do your best to avoid falling below the execution threshold (25% of your Maximum Health) until the effect times out.

AllyAdvice: Distortion allows you to be aggressive with your other spells while being able to return to safety.
EnemyAdvice: LeBlanc's ultimate can create fake LeBlancs during her spellcast or, rarely, at a distant position.

AllyAdvice: Using Distortion can help your positioning to land Ethereal Chains.
EnemyAdvice: The fake LeBlanc created at a distance will always run at the nearest Champion, cast a harmless spell, then immediately disappear.

AllyAdvice: You can chain Sigil of Malice and Ethereal Chains to prevent characters with blink from escaping for up to 4 seconds.
EnemyAdvice: Attacking LeBlanc first avoids most of her tricks, especially if she's recently used her dash, Distortion.
Stunning or silencing LeBlanc will prevent her from activating the return part of Distortion.

AllyAdvice: Transfusion instantly deals damage to the enemy before healing Vladimir, making it one of the best last hitting tools in the game.
EnemyAdvice: Try to take Vladimir down before Hemoplague detonates, as it will heal him for each afflicted enemy Champion.

AllyAdvice: Cast Hemoplague where it will afflict the most units.
EnemyAdvice: Making Vladimir use Sanguine Pool at the start of a fight will maximize the Health cost of the ability to him.

AllyAdvice: Sanguine Pool pops incoming missiles, so it can be used to dodge disables.
EnemyAdvice: Items that counter Health stacking, such as Liandry's Torment and Blade of the Ruined King, are very effective against Vladimir.

AllyAdvice: Using Divine Judgment on a high-DPS ally can turn the tides of battle by giving your ally free reign to attack.
EnemyAdvice: Divine Judgment only grants Kayle or her allies immunity to damage. Slows and stuns can still be applied, so trap them if they're being overzealous.

AllyAdvice: Kayle's attacks become incredibly powerful once she gains attack range from Divine Ascent. Play safe until then.
EnemyAdvice: Kayle is usually a fragile target. If you see her ultimate cast on an ally, switch to attacking her.

AllyAdvice: Kayle benefits greatly from Attack Damage and Ability Power, making hybrid items like Nashor's Tooth and Hextech Gunblade very effective on her.
EnemyAdvice: Kayle starts the game as a weaker melee champion. Try to put her behind before she ascends to her ranged form.

AllyAdvice: If you're in a lane against ranged players, leveling up Meditate can allow you to stay in the lane longer and gain levels faster than they will.
EnemyAdvice: Meditate is an effective method of healing damage over time, but Master Yi is susceptible to coordinated team ganks early in the game.

AllyAdvice: Wuju Style is very strong early for last hitting minions.
EnemyAdvice: If Master Yi tries to farm with Alpha Strike, hit him a few times so he has to use mana with Meditate to heal.

AllyAdvice: Try using Alpha Strike on a minion in front of an enemy champion so you are placed at a safe distance at the end of the spell.
EnemyAdvice: Although Master Yi cannot be slowed while using Highlander, other disables can stop him in his tracks.

AllyAdvice: Using Pulverize can allow you to establish better positioning for Headbutt.
EnemyAdvice: Alistar is very disruptive but very tough - try to target more fragile damage dealers.

AllyAdvice: Movement speed is very important on Alistar. Consider which boots to buy carefully.
EnemyAdvice: Watch out for the Pulverize-Headbutt combo when around turrets.

AllyAdvice: Using Flash can allow you catch your target off guard to knock them back into your allies with Pulverize and Headbutt.
EnemyAdvice: When Alistar uses his ultimate, it's often better to move back and wait until the effect wears off before attacking him.

AllyAdvice: Use Overload's passive to optimize for maximum damage or maximum speed.
EnemyAdvice: Ryze is especially dangerous to opponents that are marked with Flux.

AllyAdvice: Spell Flux's short cooldown allows it to be used to spread Flux to many enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Use Realm Warp's windup time to figure out how to deal with what may be coming out of the portal.

AllyAdvice: Ryze can move and cast other spells while Realm Warp is charging without cancelling the portal.
EnemyAdvice: Crowd controlling Ryze during Realm Warp's windup will cancel the portal.

AllyAdvice: You only have very slight turning ability during Unstoppable Onslaught, so make sure to use it in straight paths.
EnemyAdvice: Even if Sion still hits a Decimating Smash, making him release the charge earlier reduces its impact.

AllyAdvice: Roar of the Slayer is a great setup ability to land a very powerful Decimating Smash.
EnemyAdvice: Use the time after Sion has died to reposition and prepare for his return.

AllyAdvice: The Soul Furnace buff displays how much shield strength is remaining, use this information to time its explosion perfectly.
Sivir's Boomerang Blade returns to her after reaching the max range, so you can shift position to hit enemies who would otherwise have evaded it.
EnemyAdvice: Boomerang Blade costs a lot of mana to cast, so dodging it sets Sivir back. If it hits you on the way out, avoid its path on the way back.

AllyAdvice: Ricochet resets Sivir's basic attack timer on activation, so activating this immediately after landing a normal basic attack will maximize damage output.
EnemyAdvice: Sivir is a powerful pushing champion, so leaving her unattended in a lane for too long will often result in your turrets being destroyed.

AllyAdvice: Try saving Spell Shield for enemy abilities that can disable you such as stuns and roots.
EnemyAdvice: When laning against Sivir, it is possible to throw off the timing of her Spell Shield by faking an advance, then backing off.

AllyAdvice: Soraka is a powerful ally in battle, using her strong healing to keep the party moving forward.
EnemyAdvice: Focus on attacking Soraka when she ever ventures to the frontline to heal her allies.

AllyAdvice: You can use Wish on your allies from across the map to save them from otherwise fatal events.
EnemyAdvice: Take advantage of Soraka's long cooldown on Equinox if she uses it to harass.

AllyAdvice: Equinox can be used as a powerful zoning tool to keep enemies at bay.
EnemyAdvice: It's easier to focus Soraka than the ally she is healing.

AllyAdvice: Teemo's mushrooms can be used to farm creep waves very effectively.
EnemyAdvice: Teemo's Toxic Shot punishes players who get hit and back out, so stay at a safe range until you're ready to commit.

AllyAdvice: Place your mushrooms at key locations on the map, such as by the Dragon or Baron Nashor, to reveal when your enemies might be attempting to kill them.
EnemyAdvice: It can be valuable to use Oracle's Lens(Trinket) to destroy mushrooms around key locations.

AllyAdvice: Her massive gun allows Tristana to fire on targets at a great distance. Utilize this to prevent your enemies from ever laying a hand on you.
EnemyAdvice: If you see Tristana activate Rapid Fire in a fight, stun her and try to back off until the spell dissipates.

AllyAdvice: Use Rocket Jump after you have stacked up your Explosive Charge on an enemy to finish them off with a burst of damage.
EnemyAdvice: Stand away from your creeps in a lane to take less collateral damage from Explosive Charge.

AllyAdvice: Use Rapid Fire to help stack up your Explosive Charge on enemy champions.
Follow your Blood Hunt trails to low health enemy champions.
EnemyAdvice: Warwick's attacks heal him at low health. Save your disables to finish him off.

AllyAdvice: Infinite Duress (R)'s distance scales with any movement speed you gain, even from ally buffs and summoner spells.
EnemyAdvice: Warwick is empowered versus low health enemies. Manage your health to keep him at bay.

AllyAdvice: Jaws of the Beast (Q) will follow enemies who run, dash or teleport if you keep the button held down.
EnemyAdvice: Warwick's ultimate cast range scales with his movement speed.

AllyAdvice: Consume allows Nunu to stay in a lane against ranged opponents.
EnemyAdvice: Interrupting the charge up on Absolute Zero will lower the amount of damage your team takes.

AllyAdvice: You can choose to interrupt Absolute Zero early for partial damage if an opponent is about to run out of range.
EnemyAdvice: Using Summoner Flash is a surefire way to escape Absolute Zero.

AllyAdvice: It's often beneficial to delay the casting of Absolute Zero until the initial round of disables are used. Try to hang back before rushing into a team fight.
EnemyAdvice: Biggest Snowball Ever moves very fast but cannot turn as quickly, so don't try to escape it by running away in a straight line.  Instead, make sudden, sharp turns.

AllyAdvice: Miss Fortune ramps up speed if she hasn't recently taken damage. Avoid getting hit to move very fast.
EnemyAdvice: Miss Fortune's speed boost is removed if she is damaged by an enemy.

AllyAdvice: Use Double Up on the furthest enemy minion if enemy champions are hiding in back; it will bounce to them for lots of damage.
EnemyAdvice: Miss Fortune is easy to kill if you can reach her; target her first in team fights.

AllyAdvice: Make sure to utilize Love Tap while Strut is on cooldown to maximize the active's availability.
Try to fire Enchanted Crystal Arrow in the same direction enemies are moving, so it is more likely to hit.
EnemyAdvice: Ashe has very few defensive options, and she's a good target to gank.

AllyAdvice: Volley arrows are blocked by the first enemy they hit, so keep your distance to avoid having them all absorbed by enemy frontliners.
EnemyAdvice: Be wary of moving around the map alone if Ashe has not recently cast her Enchanted Crystal Arrow.

AllyAdvice: Hawkshot reveals units in brush. If a team fight is occuring in the jungle it can give you a significant advantage.
Delaying the activation of Undying Rage is a very effective way to make an enemy champion over-commit to trying to kill you.
EnemyAdvice: Try harassing Tryndamere early so he can't kill minions and heal with Bloodlust.

AllyAdvice: Bloodlust is an excellent way to heal Tryndamere. Try not to let it fade off before you activate it.
EnemyAdvice: Remember, Tryndamere can only slow you if you are facing away from him.

AllyAdvice: If the enemy is stacking Armor, try building items like Last Whisper or Youmuu's Ghostblade.
EnemyAdvice: Most of Tryndamere's damage is physical. If he's getting too strong, consider buying a Thornmail.

AllyAdvice: Jax can Leap Strike to friendly units, including wards. You can use them to plan your escape.
EnemyAdvice: Try to engage him in short bursts instead of going toe-to-toe with him. Preventing him from attacking consecutively drastically lowers his damage output.

AllyAdvice: Jax benefits greatly from items that have both Ability Power and Attack Damage such as Guinsoo's Rageblade and Hextech Gunblade.
EnemyAdvice: Jax can dodge all incoming attacks for a very short amount of time and stuns enemies in melee range when it ends. Wait to strike him until after his dodge is finished.

AllyAdvice: Shrewd use of Black Shield can determine the outcome of team fights.
EnemyAdvice: Tormented Shadow deals tons of damage to units missing large amounts of Health. When low on Health, be wary of Morgana's attempts to trap you within its reach.

AllyAdvice: Items that provide survivability allow Morgana to become extremely difficult to kill in conjunction with Black Shield and Soul Shackles.
EnemyAdvice: Morgana often needs to land Dark Binding to setup her other attacks. Use your minions as shields against Dark Binding.

AllyAdvice: Tormented Shadow is an excellent farming tool if you're by yourself in a lane.
EnemyAdvice: Black Shield makes Morgana immune to disabling effects, but can be broken with magic damage.

AllyAdvice: You can combine the use of Time Bomb and Rewind to place two Time Bombs on a target quickly. Placing the second bomb will detonate the first and stun all nearby enemies.
EnemyAdvice: If you're able to match Zilean's speed, it can sometimes be beneficial to wait until his ultimate has faded before landing the killing blow.

AllyAdvice: Time Warp is an effective way to enable allies to finish off enemies, or escape from a losing battle.
EnemyAdvice: Zilean is fragile if a team focuses on him, but otherwise he's very difficult to kill. Commit to killing him as a team.

AllyAdvice: Chronoshift is a powerful deterrent to attacking your carries, but casting Chronoshift too early in a fight can cause the enemy to switch targets too soon, making it less effective.
Poison Trail is very effective at farming and harassing, allowing Singed to dominate the flow of whatever lane he's in.
EnemyAdvice: Keep your distance to avoid being Flung back into Singed's allies.

AllyAdvice: Use Insanity Potion to trick your opponents into chasing you through your Poison Trail.
EnemyAdvice: Singed needs to run close to your team to be effective. Try to take advantage of this by using crowd control effects on him while attacking his allies.

AllyAdvice: Flinging enemies into your tower can deal heavy amounts of damage to them.
EnemyAdvice: Be careful when chasing Singed. He's very difficult to bring down, and can leave his Poison Trail to damage you in your pursuit.

AllyAdvice: Allure's arm time might seem long, but the Charm and magic resist shred put Evelynn at an exteme advantage so are worth the wait.
EnemyAdvice: Purchasing Vision Wards can help you detect Evelynn's location in order to prepare for her ambushes.

AllyAdvice: While stealthed, pay attention to when you are (near) being detected by enemy champions. This is identified by the glowing yellow and red eyes over nearby enemy champions.
EnemyAdvice: A large share of Evelynn's threat is in her charm, 'Allure.' Protect allies marked with 'Allure' or, if you are marked, make sure allies are between you and where Evelynn may attack from.

AllyAdvice: If at low health, you can take advantage of Demon Shade's healing and Camouflage to return to the fight and surprise opponents.
EnemyAdvice: If you suspect Evelynn is about to ambush one of your teammates, let them know by pinging the minimap and typing in chat.

AllyAdvice: Twitch's Attack Speed is among the highest in the game; try purchasing items with on-hit effects such as Black Cleaver or Wit's End.
EnemyAdvice: Twitch is fragile. Work with teammates to focus on him when you're able to catch him out of Camouflage.

AllyAdvice: Contaminate has a large range; apply as many stacks of Deadly Venom as possible before using it.
EnemyAdvice: Spell Shields won't block the damage from Deadly Venom, but they will block the effects Twitch can trigger with it.

AllyAdvice: You can catch up to an enemy out of attack range with Venom Cask.
EnemyAdvice: If you suspect Twitch has left the lane, let your teammates know that Twitch is ''MIA.''

AllyAdvice: Ask your allies to help point out when you should use Requiem to get kills in different lanes.
EnemyAdvice: Karthus can cast spells for a short duration after he is killed. Move away from his corpse to be safe.

AllyAdvice: Lay Waste is very strong at farming minions and harassing enemy champions.
EnemyAdvice: Make sure you always have enough health to survive Requiem, even if you have to go back to the base more frequently to heal.

AllyAdvice: Try to line up your attacks with Vorpal Spikes so that they kill minions and harass enemy champions at the same time.
EnemyAdvice: Purchasing a few HP items decreases the chances of Cho'Gath killing you quickly.

AllyAdvice: If you're having difficulty feasting upon champions, try eating minions until you're larger.
EnemyAdvice: Focus on preventing Cho'Gath from reaching his max size.

AllyAdvice: Using Rupture on creeps in combination with Carnivore is a good way to gain Health and Mana.
EnemyAdvice: Rupture has a smoke cloud indicating the area it will strike. Try to watch out for it to prevent Cho'Gath from being able to combo his abilities.

AllyAdvice: Amumu is highly dependent on teammates, so try laning with your friends for maximum effectiveness.
EnemyAdvice: Avoid bunching up with other allies when Amumu has his ultimate available.

AllyAdvice: Cooldown Reduction on Amumu is very strong, but it's often difficult to itemize for it. Grab the Golem buff whenever possible to gain Cooldown Reduction without sacrificing stats.
EnemyAdvice: Erratic movement, or hiding behind creep waves can make it difficult for Amumu to instigate a fight with Bandage Toss.

AllyAdvice: Despair is very effective against other tanks, so make sure you're in range of opponents with the highest Health.
EnemyAdvice: Amumu's Despair makes purchasing primarily Health items a risky proposition.

AllyAdvice: Powerball can be used as an effective escape mechanism.
EnemyAdvice: Pay particular attention to when his Defensive Ball Curl is off. Rammus has much lower stats than a normal tank when he's out of the stance.

AllyAdvice: Using taunt on a champion by your tower can cause the tower to attack your enemy.
EnemyAdvice: Rammus often stacks high Armor, leaving him especially vulnerable to caster damage while not in Defensive Ball Curl.

AllyAdvice: Tremors and Defensive Ball Curl can be used late in the game to obliterate towers. If you're bogged down in a team fight, it is often valuable to break off and attack the buildings.
Timing Flash Frost with Frostbite can lead to devastating combinations.
EnemyAdvice: Try to gank Anivia when she's laning. With multiple people, it is easier to ensure that her egg dies.

AllyAdvice: Anivia is extremely reliant on Mana for Glacial Storm. Try getting items with Mana or going for a Crest of the Ancient Golem buff on Summoner's Rift.
EnemyAdvice: If you're playing a ranged champion, stay far enough away from Anivia so you can dodge Flash Frost more easily.

AllyAdvice: It can be very difficult for enemy champions to kill her egg early in game. Seize the advantage by playing aggressively.
EnemyAdvice: Try to fight Anivia in the lanes. In the jungle she can block pathways with lower ranks of Crystallize.

AllyAdvice: Using Deceive over terrain can help you make a clean escape.
EnemyAdvice: If Shaco is doing well early-game, it is worth the investment to place Stealth Wards near his Jungle camps.

AllyAdvice: Try getting items with on-hit effects. These will also benefit your Hallucination clone.
EnemyAdvice: If Shaco uses Deceive to enter a fight he won't be able to quickly use it again to get away. Work with your team to quickly focus him down.

AllyAdvice: Backstab's damage can be increased with increased Critical Damage effects like Infinity Edge.
A well-timed Sadism can bait enemy champions into attacking you even when they lack the damage to finish you.
EnemyAdvice: Try to coordinate high-damage abilities with your allies right after Dr. Mundo uses his ultimate, but if you're unable to kill him quickly with burst he will heal through the damage.

AllyAdvice: Spirit Visage will increase the healing done by your ultimate and lower cooldowns on all of your abilities.
EnemyAdvice: Try casting Ignite when Dr. Mundo uses Sadism to negate a large portion of its healing.

AllyAdvice: Cleavers are a powerful tool for killing neutral monsters. Instead of returning to base, farm neutral monsters until your ultimate can heal you.
Make sure to tag your allies while Sona's auras are active, but avoid getting caught out by enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Spread out when you see Sona so she can't make your entire team dance.

AllyAdvice: Save Crescendo for the game-altering moment.
EnemyAdvice: Kill Sona first, as she will heal up her team if left alone for too long.

AllyAdvice: Well-timed uses of Aria of Perseverance will grant you maximum survivability.
Kassadin has multiple item paths; he can go caster via Mana and Ability Power or anti-caster with Cooldown Reduction and Magic Resist.
EnemyAdvice: Kassadin deals mostly magic damage. If he's doing well consider buying magic resist items like Mercury's Treads and Banshee's Veil.

AllyAdvice: Kassadin's ultimate has many uses and is on a shorter cooldown than most, use it often.
EnemyAdvice: Each time Kassadin consecutively uses Riftwalk, he pays more and more mana. Keep this in mind as you chase him.

AllyAdvice: Try to get the Ancient Golem buff to counteract Riftwalk's increasing Mana cost.
EnemyAdvice: It takes 6 spell casts for Kassadin's slow, Force Pulse, to become castable. If he levels up that ability, judiciously use your own skills while laning against him.

AllyAdvice: Use Bladesurge to cover great distances by targeting low life minions on your way to champion targets.
EnemyAdvice: Pay attention to Ionian Fervor stacks and try to engage Irelia when it is down.

AllyAdvice: Defiant Dance is not interrupted by crowd control, try timing it for incoming disables.
EnemyAdvice: Minion waves greatly enhance Irelia's mobility, beware fighting her inside one.

AllyAdvice: Flawless Duet does not have a maximum travel distance, try using it in creative ways.
EnemyAdvice: Beware of wasting your high impact spells on Defiant Dance.

AllyAdvice: Eye of the Storm can be used on allied turrets.
EnemyAdvice: Save an interrupt ability for when Janna uses her ultimate.

AllyAdvice: Quickly firing a Howling Gale without the charge up can be used to heavily disable the other team.
EnemyAdvice: Listen for the charge up sound on Howling Gale in case Janna is trying to hit you with it from off screen or from brush.

AllyAdvice: Timing Janna's ultimate can push enemies away from a wounded ally or even separate enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Janna's at her strongest when buffing another ally. If you can harass her ally, it will weaken her ability to fight you.

AllyAdvice: Parrrley applies On Hit effects like Frozen Mallet or Black Cleaver.
EnemyAdvice: Parrrley deals a high amount of physical damage. Items that grant Armor can help if an enemy Gangplank is doing well.

AllyAdvice: Paying attention to low-health enemies on the map can land you a surprise kill with Cannon Barrage.
EnemyAdvice: Once Gangplank reaches level 6, watch out for his global-range ultimate, Cannon Barrage!

AllyAdvice: Try placing Cannon Barrage on the path of escape to cut off fleeing enemies.
Phosphorus Bomb can be used to reveal enemy units that might be hiding in a nearby patch of brush.
EnemyAdvice: Watch out for Corki's Missile Barrage. They deal splash damage, so you can get hit even when hiding behind minions.

AllyAdvice: Valkyrie can be used defensively as well, so try using it for a quick escape.
EnemyAdvice: Corki is vulnerable after he uses his Valkyrie or Special Delivery, so try switching focus to him if he uses them to enter a fight.

AllyAdvice: Corki can continue to attack while using Gatling Gun. Maximizing Gatling Gun is key to mastering Corki.
Gathering Fire rewards aggressive play. Look to land abilities and basic attacks on your opponent to lower Mantra's cooldown and stay on the offensive.
EnemyAdvice: Karma's passive lowers her Mantra cooldown when she hits enemy champions with abilities and basic attacks. Deny her from getting free hits on you.

AllyAdvice: When using Focused Resolve, slow your opponents with Inner Flame or speed yourself up with Inspire if you're having trouble sticking to a target.
EnemyAdvice: Karma's Soulflare erupts for bonus damage in the area in which it's placed. React quickly and escape the circle to avoid taking heavy damage.

AllyAdvice: Don't be too conservative with Mantra. Gathering Fire is strongest in teamfights, making it easy to recharge Mantra multiple times.
EnemyAdvice: Focused Resolve is a strong disengage tool. Create distance to avoid being rooted and seek to engage afterwards.

AllyAdvice: The cooldown reducing component of Bravado makes Cooldown Reduction items like Frozen Heart, Iceborn Gauntlet, and Spirit Visage exceptionally powerful on Taric.
EnemyAdvice: Taric's ultimate, Cosmic Radiance, has a long delay before its effect. Try to quickly assess whether to disengage the fight or attempt to kill his allies before it goes off.

AllyAdvice: Using Starlight's Touch at lower charges makes its healing less Mana efficient, but can greatly increase Taric's sustained damage via Bravado.
EnemyAdvice: Taric reduces his spell cooldowns by basic attacking enemies with Bravado. Try to kite him in teamfights and punish him for approaching the minion wave in lane.

AllyAdvice: Rather than saving Cosmic Radiance for the last moment and risking someone dying during the delay, it can be more beneficial to cast it as soon as you know a teamfight is guaranteed to start.
Use Event Horizon to increase your chances of landing Dark Matter.
EnemyAdvice: Dark Matter deals very high damage, but it can be avoided. Pay attention to the sound and visual indicator to be aware of when and where the spell will land.

AllyAdvice: Veigar is extremely Mana and Cooldown Reduction dependent. Try buying items with these stats in order to increase the effectiveness of your passive and Baleful Strike.
EnemyAdvice: Event Horizon only stuns units on the edge. If you're inside the spell, you can still move and attack.

AllyAdvice: Veigar is very fragile. It is valuable to select at least one summoner spell that can be used defensively.
EnemyAdvice: Veigar's ultimate deals increased damage based on your missing health.

AllyAdvice: Trundle excels at fighting within his Frozen Domain. Try to draw enemies onto it.
EnemyAdvice: Trundle is very powerful at location-based combat. Try to draw him off of his Frozen Domain.

AllyAdvice: Use Subjugate to soften a powerful enemy tank or to create a target for your team to focus fire.
EnemyAdvice: Make sure to get out of his Pillar of Ice as quickly as possible, as it significantly slows you down.

AllyAdvice: Chomp is good for lowering the physical damage of enemies; try to focus it on enemy physical damage dealers.
If you're having trouble rooting an enemy with Nevermove, try throwing it at opponents when they are near their minions so the explosion surprises them.
EnemyAdvice: Swain's passive is very potent if you are immobilized. Make sure to be extra careful around enemies who have immobilizing effects.

AllyAdvice: While laning, try to use Death's Hand's piercing damage to damage opponents from a safe distance.
EnemyAdvice: High mobility counters all of Swain's basic abilities: Death's Hand does more damage the closer he is, Vision of Empire has a very long delay and Nevermove must start returning back to him to be dangerous.

AllyAdvice: Vision of Empire is quite difficult to land on its own, look for skirmishes around the map where enemies may be distracted or crowd controlled so you can land it more easily.
EnemyAdvice: Buying an item with Grievous Wounds will make Swain much easier to kill during his Demonic Ascension.

AllyAdvice: Demonic Ascension may make Swain very hard to kill but he's pretty easy to get away from. Try building items that can slow opponents to keep them in range if their mobility is overwhelming.
Make use of her Yordle Snap Traps by placing them pre-emptively to ensure that you'll have one off of cooldown during combat.
EnemyAdvice: Keep behind allied minions if Caitlyn is harassing you with Piltover Peacemaker (it deals less damage with each subsequent target).

AllyAdvice: Avoid using Ace in the Hole in large team melees as it might be blocked by the wrong target.
EnemyAdvice: You can intercept Ace in the Hole's missile from hitting an ally if you stand in its path.

AllyAdvice: Fire 90 Caliber Net away from the opponent to close the gap or hop over walls.
The 1-2-3 combo of Rocket Grab, Power Fist, and Static Field can devastate an individual opponent.
EnemyAdvice: Blitzcrank's passive Mana Barrier grants him a shield when he is low on health.

AllyAdvice: Using Blitzcrank's grab to pull an enemy into your tower range followed by a Power Fist will allow the tower to get several hits on them.
EnemyAdvice: Staying behind creeps can prevent you from being Rocket Grabbed. Blitzcrank's Rocket Grab only pulls the first enemy target it encounters.

AllyAdvice: Armor naturally reduces the rate that attacks go through Granite Shield, so Brutal Strikes will strengthen the shield against physical damage.
EnemyAdvice: If you're a physical damage character stay behind your allies when fighting Malphite. Ground Slam can significantly reduce your damage output.

AllyAdvice: Despite his abilities scaling on Armor, some games require Malphite to get Magic Resist. When those games occur, try getting Aegis of the Legion, Mercury's Treads, and Guardian Angel.
EnemyAdvice: Malphite is one of a couple tanks who are capable of jungling. Watch out if he gets Smite.

AllyAdvice: Picking up Daggers will significantly reduce Shunpo's cooldown.
EnemyAdvice: Katarina's abilities deal magic damage, so even if she's building Attack Damage items, get magic resistance to counter her.

AllyAdvice: Try waiting until the other team is distracted with fighting your team, and use Shunpo to teleport into the fray and unleash a devastating Death Lotus.
EnemyAdvice: Try to save a disable for when Katarina uses her Death Lotus.

AllyAdvice: Using Shunpo on an allied Champion, Dagger, or minion can be a great escape tactic.
Using Paranoia at a critical moment is well worth it even if you cannot use the dash.
EnemyAdvice: Stay close to your allies when Paranoia is cast - there is strength in numbers!

AllyAdvice: Duskbringer isn't only an offensive ability. It can be used to close distance out of combat or escape from certain death.
EnemyAdvice: Nocturne's Unspeakable Horror is broken with range, so try to save your movement abilities for when he casts it.

AllyAdvice: Use Shroud of Darkness in tandem with Paranoia's dash. Your opponents may panic and waste a critical disable on your spell shield.
Saplings can be tossed into brush for empowered effect - but don't stack well.
EnemyAdvice: Saplings will chase the first enemy that gets too close, but detonate after a few seconds or if they collide with other enemies. Be especially careful around brush sapling, as they are much more dangerous.

AllyAdvice: Try looking for flanks or other situations where Nature's Grasp is unavoidable or takes enemies by surprise.
EnemyAdvice: The cooldown on Maokai's self healing is heavily gated on how many time you hit him with spells. Careful about wasting abilities on him.

AllyAdvice: Maokai's passive makes him extremely durable against focus fire from spells - so long as he can still basic attack something.
EnemyAdvice: Maokai will avoid taking damage while he's using Twisted Advance, so don't waste your spells.

AllyAdvice: Slice and Dice excels at harassing maneuvers. Slice in, follow up with another skill and then Dice back out to safety.
EnemyAdvice: Pay close attention to Renekton's Fury gauge as that will usually signify when he is about to attack.

AllyAdvice: Cull the Meek drains an enormous amount of life when used in the middle of the fray. You can use this to bait opponents into thinking you are weaker than you really are.
EnemyAdvice: Keeping Renekton from being able to fight and gain Fury by continually harassing him will severely reduce the effectiveness of his abilities.

AllyAdvice: Cooldown reduction is especially good for Renekton, allowing him to both quickly build up and use his Fury.
You can use the Dragon Strike / Demacian Standard combo to get out of your own Cataclysm arenas.
EnemyAdvice: Keep out of the path between Jarvan IV and his Demacian Standard to avoid being knocked up in the air.

AllyAdvice: Split your basic attacks on different champions at the beginning of fights to maximize damage.
EnemyAdvice: Cataclysm's terrain is a frightening force to fight against, but movement abilities can go through it.

AllyAdvice: Use Demacian Standard as a scouting tool when worried about incoming enemies.
Spider Form is most effective at finishing off enemies with low health; Human Form's Neurotoxin does more damage to healthy foes.
EnemyAdvice: Elise's Spider Form is more dangerous when you are at low health, and her Human Form more potent when you are at high health.

AllyAdvice: When in Spider Form, Spiderlings will attack the target that Elise uses Venomous Bite on.
EnemyAdvice: Rappel will only move Elise straight up and down unless she can descend upon an enemy unit.

AllyAdvice: Elise's Spider Form and Spider Form abilities do not cost mana and can be prioritized when you are trying to conserve mana.
EnemyAdvice: Rappel has a long cooldown. Elise is vulnerable after she has used it.

AllyAdvice: Command: Protect can be used on yourself to return the Ball back to you quickly. Combine this with Command: Attack for a quick harassment.
EnemyAdvice: Orianna can only affect the area the Ball is around. Use this to your advantage.

AllyAdvice: Command: Dissonance is a very powerful escape tool if Orianna has the Ball. The combination of speed and leaving a slowing obstacle can be quite powerful.
EnemyAdvice: Watch out for Orianna's Ball returning to her due to leashing. This may cause some unexpected situations.

AllyAdvice: Command: Shockwave can be used to drag enemies towards you or away from you if you position the Ball properly.
Decoy and Nimbus Strike work well together to quickly strike your enemy and get out before they can retaliate.
EnemyAdvice: Wukong will often use Decoy after Nimbus Strike. Try delaying your abilities by a short amount of time to ensure that you're hitting the real Wukong.

AllyAdvice: Try using Decoy near brush to make an enemy overreact to your movement.
EnemyAdvice: Wukong becomes tougher to kill when surrounded by his enemies. Try to isolate him to gain an advantage.

AllyAdvice: You can deter enemies from standing near their minions by setting them ablaze, due to Conflagration.
EnemyAdvice: Brand must land an ability before his combo is able to get started. Dodging his Sear or Pillar of Flame will disrupt his rhythm.

AllyAdvice: You can use Brand's abilities in a variety of combinations to maximize his damage in different situations.
EnemyAdvice: Try to move away from allies when you see Pyroclasm being cast. The initial missile speed is slow, which should give your team time to react.

AllyAdvice: Pyroclasm bounces randomly between enemies, so try to cast it on a small group of enemies if you want to hit the same target multiple times.
EnemyAdvice: Brand's passive allows him to excel against teams that cluster together. Be sure to split up against him.

AllyAdvice: Use Sonic Wave before Dragon's Rage so you can chase the target with Resonating Strike.
EnemyAdvice: Stay spread out to minimize the impact of Lee Sin's ultimate, Dragon's Rage.

AllyAdvice: Take advantage of Flurry by weaving in basic attacks between spell casts - this maximizes damage output and minimizes Energy loss.
EnemyAdvice: Lee Sin has powerful tools to combat physical damage in Iron Will and Cripple but he is still vulnerable to magic damage.

AllyAdvice: Self-casting Safeguard and using Iron Will are powerful tools for killing neutral monsters (in the jungle).
EnemyAdvice: Lee Sin relies heavily on following up with his abilities. Use disables to prevent him from chaining together his abilities and attacks.

AllyAdvice: Tumble has many uses, but it cannot pass over walls.
EnemyAdvice: Vayne is fragile - turn the pressure up on her and she will be forced to play cautiously.

AllyAdvice: Condemn can be used to both pin targets to walls to ensure a kill, or to escape a pursuer.
EnemyAdvice: Deny Vayne the opportunity to pin you against walls.

AllyAdvice: Don't go in first to a large teamfight. Wait for your teammates to initiate.
Try and pace yourself to stay in the Danger Zone to maximize your effectiveness. It is easy to overheat if you rapidly use your abilities.
EnemyAdvice: Watch Rumble's Heat bar carefully. If you see him Overheat, go in for the kill while his skills are disabled.

AllyAdvice: Try and keep targets in the range of your Flamespitter. It can deal a lot of damage overtime.
EnemyAdvice: Rumble's ultimate can deal a lot of damage if you stay inside the area of effect. When you see the missiles falling, move out of the way as quickly as possible.

AllyAdvice: If you are winning a fight you can use your ultimate to wall off an escape path.
EnemyAdvice: Rumble deals almost entirely magic damage. Build some Magic Resistance to reduce his damage.

AllyAdvice: Use Twin Fang on poisoned stationary targets like monsters and units stunned by her Petrifying Gaze for maximum damage.
EnemyAdvice: Be wary of Cassiopeia's damage potential with Twin Fang when she has you poisoned.

AllyAdvice: Lead your enemy when targeting with Noxious Blast to ensure the hit.
EnemyAdvice: Turn away from Cassiopeia when she is casting Petrifying Gaze to get slowed instead of stunned.

AllyAdvice: Basic attacks reduce the cooldown of Crystal Slash. Use them as often as possible for maximum damage.
EnemyAdvice: Skarner can't harm you very much outside of short range, so stay away from him!

AllyAdvice: Capturing Crystal Spires before attempting neutral objectives or team fights around them improves Skarner's performance in said fights dramatically.
EnemyAdvice: Skarner's Movement Speed is increased as long as his shield, Crystalline Exoskeleton, persists. Attack him to lower his speed.

AllyAdvice: Impale is extremely powerful when you use it to position an enemy so your allies can attack them.
EnemyAdvice: Skarner is especially dangerous when inside Crystal Spire zones his team controls. Try to capture them ahead of time if a fight may break out around them.

AllyAdvice: Turret placement can be a deciding factor in a battle. Against most enemies turrets are best when they can support each other, but if the enemy has a lot of area of effect damage your turrets can be destroyed quickly. Placing turrets in brush can lead to a surprise attack in your favor.
EnemyAdvice: It's better to destroy all of Heimerdinger's turrets at once with the help of creeps than to fight them one at a time.

AllyAdvice: The success of Electron Storm Grenade is very important to Heimerdinger's survival. The slow and stun both are capable of keeping enemies in place long enough to punish them, but it is also the first line of defense against a surprise attack.
EnemyAdvice: Be wary of Heimerdinger's Upgrade!!!, as he can use it to find an answer to most trouble he gets into. Once his ultimate is down, go in for the kill!

AllyAdvice: Spreading out Hextech Micro-Rockets leads to more reliable damage and more efficiency against multiple targets, but focusing it creates the biggest impact.
Paying attention to last hitting with Siphoning Strike will have a large impact at the end of a game.
EnemyAdvice: While transformed by his ultimate, Nasus is stronger than most champions in the League. Engage him only if you have a clear advantage.

AllyAdvice: If you're solo, Spirit Fire is a great way to farm a lane. It can be bad if you're in a lane with 2 and you push too far. Find the right balance between Siphoning Strike last hits and AoE farming.
EnemyAdvice: Max rank Wither is a very effective counter to Attack Damage characters, so try to avoid getting caught alone by it.

AllyAdvice: If you have low defenses, people will focus you down even during your ultimate. Try buying some survivability items even in your DPS builds.
EnemyAdvice: Nasus is prone to being kited. Try not to engage him at full Health.

AllyAdvice: Use brush to your advantage! Moving in and out of brush can heavily alter your effectiveness in battle.
EnemyAdvice: Nidalee's Hunt debuff is only applied with Javelin Toss and Bushwhack. Avoiding being hit by these abilities will impair her ability to deal follow-up damage.

AllyAdvice: Start team fights by harassing with your Javelin Toss, and then switch to cougar form to chase down Hunted targets.
EnemyAdvice: Nidalee's Javelin Toss deals more damage the farther she is. If she is far away, it's imperative to dodge it.

AllyAdvice: Bushwhack traps deal damage based on their victim's current Health. Set them up in your team's backline before fights break out during sieges to help your team deal damage to the enemy frontline.
EnemyAdvice: Nidalee's Takedown deals extreme damage to Hunted targets, but she has to get close to use it. Save your crowd control or defensive abilities for when she goes in for the kill.

AllyAdvice: Damage is applied to turtle shield post-mitigation. Therefore, buying defensive items can drastically increase your survivability.
EnemyAdvice: Udyr players will often start in the jungle and only appear to gank in lanes. Try warding key locations to keep track of his movement.

AllyAdvice: Udyr is one of the best junglers in the game. Taking advantage of this can give your team a large XP advantage and map control.
EnemyAdvice: Once the initial shield effect has faded, Turtle Stance is weak against other champions. Press the attack to force him to switch stances and prevent him from regenerating health.
Some Udyr players buy tank items to become very durable. If they do, focus their weaker teammates instead.

AllyAdvice: Iron Ambassador tends to land near walls, try to take advantage of this with Heroic Charge.
EnemyAdvice: Poppy can stop nearby enemies from dashing with Steadfast Presence.

AllyAdvice: Keeper's Verdict can be released immediately to send the enemy straight up, take advantage of this in duels.
EnemyAdvice: When Poppy starts to spin her hammer, she is charging Keeper's Verdict.
You can step on Poppy's shield to deny it from her.

AllyAdvice: The damage reduction from Drunken Rage is applied when you start drinking, try to use it when you see damage coming your way.
EnemyAdvice: Gragas can knock everybody away with his ultimate. Be careful that you don't get knocked into him or, worse, an enemy tower.

AllyAdvice: Try to knock enemies back into your towers with Explosive Cask.
EnemyAdvice: Body Slam is on a very low cooldown, making it difficult to pursue Gragas. Don't overextend yourself chasing him.

AllyAdvice: Try to combo Body Slam with Explosive Cask to set up kills for your team.
Mortal Will activates after 5 spells or basic attacks - plan your way through fights to allow you to activate it more than once.
EnemyAdvice: Pantheon's Aegis Assault makes him invulnerable from the front. Get behind him or wait it out.

AllyAdvice: Whittle the enemy down with Comet Spears before you jump in.
EnemyAdvice: Be careful near Pantheon if your health is low - a thrown Comet Spear executes low health enemies.

AllyAdvice: If an enemy is going to get out of range of your Aegis Assault, you can recast the spell to immediately fire the shield slam.
EnemyAdvice: Grand Starfall gives several seconds of warning before Pantheon arrives. Use this time to get out of the way or to form a plan to deal with him.

AllyAdvice: Use Arcane Shift to help line up your other skill shots.
EnemyAdvice: Ezreal is a very fragile champion so take the fight to him.

AllyAdvice: You can play Ezreal either as a Attack Damage carry or Ability Power carry depending on how you build him.
EnemyAdvice: Ezreal is completely skill shot based, so make sure to keep minions in between you.

AllyAdvice: You can line up Trueshot Barrage to hit multiple minion waves or even Monsters.
EnemyAdvice: Mystic Shot applies on-hit effects including the Crest of Cinders.

AllyAdvice: Offense is your defense. Keep fighting to build up larger Indestructible shields.
EnemyAdvice: Mordekaiser builds up a powerful damage aura when fighting champions, so keep your distance.

AllyAdvice: Hitting multiple champions with the same ability can help quickly activate Darkness Rise.
EnemyAdvice: Damage he deals can be converted into a large shield, and consumed for health

AllyAdvice: Use Realm of Death on a low health enemy to guarantee the kill and keep their stats for the rest of a teamfight.
EnemyAdvice: Realm of Death will cut you off from your teammates completely. Try to save mobility spells to escape Mordekaiser once inside

AllyAdvice: You do not need to cast Awakening to regain the ability to cast Last Rites.
EnemyAdvice: You can cast Smite on Mist Walkers and the Maiden of the Mist to damage or kill them.

AllyAdvice: The Maiden will attempt to assist you in a fight, so choose your targets well.
EnemyAdvice: Try to thin out Yorick's minions before you engage him, Mist Walkers will die from a basic attack or a single target spell.

AllyAdvice: You can send the Maiden down a lane alone, be careful though, as she represents a large portion of your combat power.
EnemyAdvice: You can attack Dark Procession to break the wall down.

AllyAdvice: Akali excels at killing fragile champions. Let your team initiate and then strike at the people in the back.
EnemyAdvice: Akali can still be hit by area effect spells while obscured inside Twilight Shroud. Doing so will briefly reveal her position.

AllyAdvice: Twilight Shroud offers safety in even the most dangerous situations. Use that time to save up energy for a quick strike later.
EnemyAdvice: Akali's Five Point Strike is powerful when used at maximum range and energy. Engage on her when she has low energy to maximize your chance of winning trades.
Return to base if your Health is low and Akali has her ultimate available.

AllyAdvice: You can stun your opponents by inflicting 3 Marks of the Storm upon them.
EnemyAdvice: Consider playing a bit more cautiously around Kennen when you have a Mark of the Storm debuff. If he hits you with 3 Marks of the Storm, you will get stunned.

AllyAdvice: Lightning Rush can be used to initiate fights with its Energy return component, allowing him to use other abilities afterward.
EnemyAdvice: Kennen is flimsy by nature - turn and attack him if he gets careless with Lightning Rush.

AllyAdvice: You can land an initial Mark of the Storm debuff on an opponent with Thundering Shuriken, and then add to it with Electrical Surge.
Garen's regeneration greatly increases if he can avoid receiving damage for several seconds.
EnemyAdvice: Stack armor items to lower the large amount of physical damage that Garen deals out.

AllyAdvice: Judgment deals maximum damage when only hitting a single target. For effective trading, try to position such that only the enemy champion is hit.
EnemyAdvice: Try to run away from Garen as your health gets lower, as he can execute you quickly with Demacian Justice.

AllyAdvice: Garen is only constrained by cooldowns, making items such as Black Cleaver very effective for him.
EnemyAdvice: Be careful about attacking Garen in brush. It often will lead to taking full damage from Judgment.
Judgment deals maximum damage when only hitting a single target. If getting out of its radius isn't possible, move through allied minions to reduce damage taken.

AllyAdvice: Lead the charge and mark your foes with Sunlight before your allies deal damage.
EnemyAdvice: When Leona activates Eclipse, you have three seconds to get away from her before she deals damage.

AllyAdvice: Shield of Daybreak and Zenith Blade form a powerful offensive combo.
EnemyAdvice: Only foes in the center of Solar Flare get stunned, so you can often avoid this if you're quick.

AllyAdvice: You can absorb a huge amount of damage using Eclipse, but you must stay near enemies to gain the bonus duration.
Wait to cast Void Swarm until there are nearby enemies for the Voidling to attack or kill.
EnemyAdvice: When Malzahar hits a spell on enemies affected by Malefic Visions, the Visions are refreshed.

AllyAdvice: Use Call of the Void and Nether Grasp to renew the duration of Malefic Visions on enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Avoid minion waves that have been affected by Malefic Visions. You never know when they may die and pass the Visions onto you.

AllyAdvice: Avoiding damage in lane maximizes the uptime on Void Shift, increasing Malzahar's safety dramatically.
EnemyAdvice: Malzahar is especially dangerous when he has built up his Void Swarm.

AllyAdvice: You can use Assassin's Path to get behind the enemy and set up for Noxian Diplomacy's melee attack.
EnemyAdvice: Talon's attacks are all physical damage. Build armor early to counter his burst damage.

AllyAdvice: Shadow Assault is a powerful escape tool, but can also be offensively used to assault a group.
EnemyAdvice: Talon is heavily reliant on Shadow Assault to escape a fight. When it is down he's significantly more vulnerable.

AllyAdvice: Remember to pick your target before the fight. Focusing all of Talon's abilities on one target can be very rewarding, but splitting them up between many may leave you helpless.
EnemyAdvice: Talon has unrivaled roaming ability. Make sure to keep track of his position or force him to stay in lane by pushing aggressively.

AllyAdvice: Riven's Broken Wings locks onto the champion your cursor is over at the time of cast. If you want to move past your opponent, make sure that your cursor is past your opponent as well.
EnemyAdvice: Riven has a great deal of mobility but she cannot move very far with any one skill. Rooting or silencing her during her combo will greatly reduce her effectiveness.

AllyAdvice: Riven lacks a source of healing or strong defense and must compensate with burst combos. Lead into fights with Broken Wings and Ki Burst, while using Valor to escape and absorb counter-harass.
EnemyAdvice: All of Riven's damage is physical, prioritize high Armor if an opposing Riven gets out of control.

Riven excels at dueling multiple melee attackers at once, as she will be on an almost equal footing damage-wise. If pairing up against Riven, don't go in as double melee until she has expended her full combo.

AllyAdvice: Kog'Maw can outrange most champions with his Bio-Arcane Barrage ability.
EnemyAdvice: Kog'Maw doesn't have a good escape ability, so he is especially prone to ganks.

AllyAdvice: Use Void Ooze to set up a perfect Living Artillery.
EnemyAdvice: Run away from Kog'Maw after he dies!!!!

AllyAdvice: Make the most out of your Icathian Surprise.
EnemyAdvice: The range on Living Artillery increases each rank.
Bio-Arcane Barrage allows Kog'Maw to kill Baron Nashor extremely early. It can be valuable to ward Nashor when Kog'Maw completes his Blade of the Ruined King.

AllyAdvice: Keep an eye on allies and be ready to save them with your teleport.
EnemyAdvice: Be ready to dodge Shen's taunt and punish him if he misses.

AllyAdvice: Leverage your Energy to get a long-term advantage over Mana users.
EnemyAdvice: Once Shen reaches level 6, watch out for his global-range ultimate, which can turn fights quickly.

AllyAdvice: Lux has great zone control abilities. Try to set up Lucent Singularity to prevent an enemy's advance or escape.
EnemyAdvice: Lux has powerful zone control abilities. Try to spread out and attack from different directions so she cannot lock down a specific area.

AllyAdvice: If you have trouble landing Prismatic Barrier, remember that it returns to you after it reaches max range. Try positioning yourself to hit your allies with its return trip.
EnemyAdvice: When retreating with low health, be prepared to dodge Lux's Final Spark, a red targeting beam fires prior to the main beam, so try to move to the side if possible.

AllyAdvice: Lucent Singularity is a great scouting tool. Try throwing it into brush before walking into it to check for ambushes.
It's easier to land Arcanopulse on an enemy when they're moving toward or away from you, rather than side to side.
EnemyAdvice: Xerath's range can be intimidating, but most champions who close distance with him can trade favorably.

AllyAdvice: Eye of Destruction will make landing Arcanopulse easier as the target will be slowed.
EnemyAdvice: Xerath takes a long time to engage Rite of the Arcane. Watch for his spellcast animation and start dodging.

AllyAdvice: If you stun an enemy with Shocking Orb, follow up with a guaranteed center hit on Eye of Destruction.
EnemyAdvice: Banshee's Veil will make it much harder for Xerath to land Shocking Orb on you.

AllyAdvice: Shyvana's abilities all benefit from attacking units. As a result, Attack Speed items are more valuable on her than most champions.
EnemyAdvice: A significant portion of Shyvana's power is generated through aggression, making her weak against opponents who are able to keep their distance.

AllyAdvice: Flame Breath is great to level-up against difficult lane opponents.
EnemyAdvice: All of Shyvana's basic abilities hit multiple enemies in dragon form. It's important for opposing champions to not cluster while fighting her.

AllyAdvice: Burnout is an ideal choice for jungling. Monsters will be hit by the full duration, and the speed boost improves her ganking potential.
EnemyAdvice: Shyvana's Fury Bar indicate her ultimate can be activated. Harassing her when she's low on Fury can be very effective.

AllyAdvice: It can be valuable to purchase one of the items that can slow enemies: Frozen Mallet, Dead Man's Plate, or Entropy.
Use Charm to set up your combos, it will make landing Orb of Deception and Fox-Fire dramatically easier.
EnemyAdvice: Ahri's survivability is dramatically reduced when her Ultimate, Spirit Rush, is down.

AllyAdvice: Initiate team fights using Charm, and chase down stragglers with Spirit Rush.
EnemyAdvice: Stay behind minions to make Charm difficult to land, this will reduce Ahri's damage potential significantly.

AllyAdvice: Spirit Rush enables Ahri's abilities, it opens up paths for Charm, helps double hitting with Orb of Deception, and closes to make use of Fox-Fire.
Smoke Screen can be used both to escape and to set up a kill.
EnemyAdvice: Graves deals mostly physical damage so Armor is an effective counter.

AllyAdvice: Using Quickdraw to get into range and delivering a point blank Buckshot can do lots of damage.
EnemyAdvice: Leaving the Smoke Screen's area of effect removes the harmful effect immediately.

AllyAdvice: Since Fizz can move through units, find opportunities in lane to walk through minions and apply Seastone Trident's passive - following it up with the ability's active attack after a few seconds.
EnemyAdvice: Fizz's attacks becomes more deadly for a few seconds after he uses his empowered attack - keep him away while his trident is glowing!

AllyAdvice: Fizz's ultimate ability, Chum the Waters, can be aimed at an enemy or towards the area where you think they'll be going.
EnemyAdvice: Fizz is a slippery target when his abilities are not on cooldown - bait him into using them early and follow up with crowd control or hard-hitting attacks!

AllyAdvice: Fizz's spells scale off Ability Power - consider getting items like Zhonya's Hourglass or Banshee's Veil against teams that have high burst threat - and items like Lich Bane or Rabadon's Deathcap if you think you can survive without the Health.
Use Rengar's ultimate to find and assassinate high priority targets in team fights and skirmishes.
EnemyAdvice: Rengar gains an empowered ability when his resource bar is full. Try to confront him when it's low.

AllyAdvice: A lot of Rengar's power comes from empowered abilities he uses at the right moment - choose wisely!
EnemyAdvice: Rengar's passive enables him to leap out of brush, so avoid fighting him when near bushes.

AllyAdvice: Make sure to take paths through brush when chasing opponents to take advantage of Rengar's passive.
EnemyAdvice: Rengar puts an indicator over the nearest enemy champion when he is camouflaged during his ultimate.

AllyAdvice: An early point in Blighted Quiver helps harass enemy champions and get killing blows on minions.
EnemyAdvice: If you are affected by Blight, Varus' abilities will deal extra damage to you.

AllyAdvice: During short range fights it's sometimes best to fire Piercing Arrow quickly, rather than charging it to full power.
EnemyAdvice: When he gets a kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Speed and is much more dangerous.

AllyAdvice: Try to take advantage of Piercing Arrow's very long range to snipe at enemy champions before a fight or as they're trying to flee.
EnemyAdvice: You'll get bound in place if a tendril from Varus' ultimate, Chain of Corruption, reaches you. You can cause the tendril to die however by running far enough away from it.

AllyAdvice: While ganking, consider aiming Dredge Line at nearby terrain and following it up with Riptide for a higher hit rate.
EnemyAdvice: If Nautilus uses Riptide right next to you, hold in place until the ripple effect finishes before running. Running early will run straight into the secondary explosions, causing you to take additional damage and slow.

AllyAdvice: Riptide has a delayed blast timing on activation - you can use this while running away or when enemies are incoming to serve as a deterrent.
EnemyAdvice: While Nautilus is shielded, he is capable of dealing large amounts of area of effect damage with his basic attacks - consider taking down the shield if you have time.

AllyAdvice: Death Ray is a powerful poke and a strong area of denial tool. Use it in combination with Gravity Field to control your enemy's position.
EnemyAdvice: Be careful about how close you let Viktor get to you. Viktor's control of the battlefield increases with his proximity to his opponent.

AllyAdvice: Make sure you choose the right augment at the right time.
EnemyAdvice: Be aware of how many augments Viktor has upgraded by looking at the color of the light on his staff (purple, yellow, blue, red).

AllyAdvice: Use Arctic Assault to escape bad situations, interupt channeled spells or chase runners.
EnemyAdvice: Dodging Arctic Assault and Glacial Prison can give you a huge advantage.

AllyAdvice: Melee allies can stack Frost for your Permafrost, keep an eye on who they are attacking.
EnemyAdvice: Focus on avoiding the second swing of Winter's Wrath which carries the brunt of the damage.

AllyAdvice: Save Glacial Prison for encounters where you have teammates present to take advantage of it.
EnemyAdvice: Melee enemies can also stack Frost for Sejuani, be very careful around them.

AllyAdvice: Thanks to Duelist's Dance, Fiora excels at quick trades. Use the movement speed boost from striking a Vital to escape unscathed or set up for the next one.
EnemyAdvice: Duelist's Dance shows you where Fiora will try to attack from, so be ready to punish her when she tries.

AllyAdvice: Grand Challenge allows Fiora to take down even the most durable opponents and then recover if successful, so do not hesitate to attack the enemy's front line.
EnemyAdvice: Be careful when casting immobilizing disables on Fiora. If her Riposte is available, she can turn their power against you.

AllyAdvice: Even if you're far from a fight you can still help from afar with Mega Inferno Bomb.
EnemyAdvice: Don't step on Ziggs' mines! They'll slow you and make it much easier for him to hit you with his other abiltiies.

AllyAdvice: Slowing your enemies with Hexplosive Minefield makes it easier to land other abilities.
EnemyAdvice: Many of Ziggs' abilities have long cooldowns. Try catching him just after he's used his abilities.

AllyAdvice: Knocking yourself over walls with Satchel Charge can be great when chasing after or escaping from enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Ziggs' ultimate, Mega Inferno Bomb, deals more damage in the center of the explosion.

AllyAdvice: Glitterlance can be fired at odd angles depending on where your cursor is - Moving your cursor closer to Pix and Lulu will change your area of effect size considerably.
EnemyAdvice: The shots from Lulu's faerie can be intercepted - hide behind your minions to avoid the additional Faerie attacks.

AllyAdvice: Consider casting Help, Pix! on ranged attackers for the Pix boost and Wild Growth on Tanks or Fighters for the added initiation power.
EnemyAdvice: Lulu excels when opponents heavily commit. Don't give her this chance! Use heavy harass tactics instead to force Lulu and her partner out of lane.

AllyAdvice: If Draven doesn't move, Spinning Axe will fall near his present location. It will fall directly on him, or just to the right or left.
EnemyAdvice: Launch skillshots toward the landing position of Draven's Spinning Axes.

AllyAdvice: If Draven does move after attacking, Spinning Axe will lead him in the direction of his movement. Use this to control where the Spinning Axe will go.
EnemyAdvice: Disrupt Draven with the goal of making him drop his axes. If you do, his power drops dramatically.

AllyAdvice: Spirit of Dread restores Health when nearby enemies take damage, including damage dealt by allies. Cast this during a large fight to maximize Hecarim's survivability.
EnemyAdvice: Hecarim gains life from nearby enemies with Spirit of Dread but lacks durability, use burst damage.

AllyAdvice: Devastating Charge deals more damage based on the distance traveled. Try using Onslaught of Shadows or Summoner Spells such as Ghost or Flash to maximize this damage.
EnemyAdvice: Hecarim's ultimate causes opponents to flee in terror. Spread out to reduce his power in fights.

AllyAdvice: Enemies are considered isolated if they have no allies within a short distance. The damage of Taste Their Fear is massively increased against these targets.
EnemyAdvice: Taste Their Fear deals bonus damage to targets that are isolated. Gain an advantage by fighting near allied minions, champions, or turrets.

AllyAdvice: Unseen Threat activates when Kha'Zix cannot be seen by the enemy team. Reactivate by using brush or Void Assault. Don't forget to apply Unseen Threat by autoattacking enemy champions.
EnemyAdvice: Leap and Void Assault have long cooldowns. Kha'Zix is very vulnerable when these are not available.

AllyAdvice: Kha'Zix has a great deal of freedom to choose where and when to fight. Pick your battles carefully to succeed.
Decimate is a powerful harassment ability. Strike an enemy from maximum range for the greatest effect.
EnemyAdvice: When Darius's axe grab is on cooldown, he is vulnerable to harassment attacks.

AllyAdvice: Noxian Guillotine does more damage the more attacks you can land prior to it. Use Noxian Might to deal maximum damage.
EnemyAdvice: Darius's ability to escape from fights is limited. If you have an advantage against him, press your lead.

AllyAdvice: Darius benefits greatly from enhanced survivability. The longer you can prolong a fight, the more powerful he becomes.
Be sure to switch stances often. It will enhance your attacks and grant you quick bursts of speed.
EnemyAdvice: Jayce can attack in melee or at range. Pay attention to his stance and weapon color to know how he is going to attack.

AllyAdvice: If you find yourself taking lots of damage, try using Jayce's Hammer Stance, as it grants you additional defenses.
EnemyAdvice: If you see Jayce drop his Acceleration Gate, be careful, he is probably about to cast Shock Blast.

AllyAdvice: For increased range and damage, try casting Shock Blast through the Acceleration Gate.
EnemyAdvice: Jayce is strong in the early game. If he gains the advantage, play defensively.

AllyAdvice: You can instantly use your ultimate on yourself by pressing the self cast key and the ultimate key at once (alt+R by default).
EnemyAdvice: The best way to stop Lissandra from moving using her Glacial Path is to immobilize her before she reactivates it.

AllyAdvice: Casting Glacial Path and then running in the opposite direction will leave your enemies uncertain which way you will actually go.
EnemyAdvice: Lissandra's Ring of Frost has a long cooldown at early ranks; engage her while it's on cooldown.

AllyAdvice: Lissandra's abilities are shorter range than those of many mages. As a result, buying items that offer both ability power and defense, like Zhonya's Hourglass and Banshee's Veil, can be a great choice to help her both survive and deal damage.
EnemyAdvice: Lissandra's Ice Shard only slows the first unit it hits. Approach Lissandra from behind your team's minions to avoid being slowed.

AllyAdvice: Landing Crescent Strike is critically important, but don't be afraid to miss. The cooldown is short and the mana cost is low.
EnemyAdvice: Dodge Crescent Strike, or move to safety if you are affected by Moonlight.

AllyAdvice: Consider when to cast Lunar Rush without Moonlight and when to wait for another Crescent Strike.
EnemyAdvice: Pale Cascade orbs only last a few seconds. Avoid Diana and engage her after the shield dissipates.

AllyAdvice: Use Moonfall and Lunar Rush to stay on targets and activate Moonsilver Blade for extra damage.
EnemyAdvice: Diana can play very aggressively if she uses Lunar Rush without Moonlight, but you can punish her by slowing or stunning her when she has no way to get back into position.

AllyAdvice: Attacking a Vulnerable  target marked by Valor will put Harrier on cooldown. Quickly consuming Harrier marks will allow you to generate them faster.
EnemyAdvice: After being marked, move away from Quinn so she can't take advantage of it.

AllyAdvice: Vault is powerful but must be used with caution, as enemies can attack Quinn when she strikes them. Vault can sometimes be used to cross terrain if your back is to a wall.
EnemyAdvice: Keep tabs on Quinn's position. Behind Enemy Lines can enable Valor to cross the map very quickly and attack you by surprise.

AllyAdvice: Use Behind Enemy Lines for traveling very long distances quickly, for farming minions around the map, or for chasing wounded targets.
EnemyAdvice: When Quinn is using Behind Enemy Lines, damaging her removes her movement speed bonus temporarily.

AllyAdvice: To maximize your ultimate's damage use it when there are many spheres on the battlefield.
EnemyAdvice: Get boots early when playing against Syndra, they'll help you avoid many of her spells.

AllyAdvice: After you hit an enemy champion with Force of Will follow up with Dark Sphere, they'll be slowed and have a hard time avoiding it.
EnemyAdvice: Attack Syndra after she's used Scatter the Weak, it has a long cooldown so she'll be vulnerable.

AllyAdvice: Get one of your spells to rank 5 as quickly as possible, they gain powerful bonus effects at max rank.
EnemyAdvice: At max rank Syndra's spells gain bonus effects and change in appearance.

AllyAdvice: You can use Comet of Legend's flight to grow Starsurge to massive proportions.
EnemyAdvice: Try to get inside his orbit, since his stars can't hurt you up close.

AllyAdvice: Save Voice of Light to use as a defense against melee opponents if you need to - otherwise, use its slow to start a fight at long range.
EnemyAdvice: His stars disappear while stunned or silenced, giving you an easy opportunity to fight him.

AllyAdvice: Comet of Legend allows you to move quickly around the map; use it to put pressure on other lanes.
EnemyAdvice: He gains speed while chasing in a straight line, but taking damage makes him lose that momentum.
His Starsurge ability can grow to cover a huge area - don't stay in the same place too long!

AllyAdvice: Look at the line-up of both your team and the enemy's team when picking your form.
EnemyAdvice: Umbral Trespass requires Kayn to damage a target first. Try to dodge Blade's Reach to deny him a long range cast of Umbral Trespass.

AllyAdvice: Remember that nearby enemies can see which wall you're in.
EnemyAdvice: When Kayn is in terrain near you, you will get a visual warning on the edge of the terrain he's in.
Damage Kayn while he's in Shadow Step to shorten its duration, or apply hard crowd control (stun, charm, knockup, etc) to end Shadow Step immediately.

AllyAdvice: Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown. Casting it behind yourself before redirecting can deal tons of damage.
EnemyAdvice: Zoe's Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown.

AllyAdvice: Break Sleep with your biggest damage source, since enemies who are asleep take double damage.
EnemyAdvice: Zoe must return to her starting point after casting Portal Jump, making her vulnerable to a counterattack.

AllyAdvice: Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Find a hiding spot to set up for a long distance kill.
EnemyAdvice: Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Stop Zoe from hiding in fog of war to prevent her from setting the spell up.

AllyAdvice: Placing a seed in your spell's path after you have cast it gives you the best chance of having a seed in the proper spot.
EnemyAdvice: Zyra's seeds can be destroyed by stepping on them. If she tries to grow them as you do, dodge back at the last moment.

AllyAdvice: Seeds grant vision to your team.
EnemyAdvice: Moving closer to Zyra can be a smart move if she places plants too far away from herself.

AllyAdvice: Zyra is a great ambusher - look for opportunities to set a trap of seeds in brush, then lure enemies in.
EnemyAdvice: Plants take fixed damage from attacks and effects, similar to wards. They also expire quickly on their own. Moving the fight to a different area will deprive Zyra of accumulated seeds.
Seeds placed by Zyra's W are larger, a different color, and grant a small amount of vision to her team.

AllyAdvice: Try to catch enemy carries alone to burst them with Icathian Rain.
EnemyAdvice: Kai'Sa is very good at picking off isolated enemies. Stick together against her.

AllyAdvice: Work with your teammates to set up your Ultimate and optimize damage with your passive.
EnemyAdvice: Kai'Sa is very vulnerable to getting outranged by mages and long range carries.

AllyAdvice: Make sure to buy items that will evolve at least 1 or 2 of your spells.
EnemyAdvice: Make sure to place wards in your blind spots so you can see Kai'Sa coming.

AllyAdvice: Managing your Rage is very important. Try to time out your transformations so you can get maximum benefit from both forms.
EnemyAdvice: Gnar can't gain Rage for 15 seconds after he turns from big to little. Use this chance to engage on his team.

AllyAdvice: Position yourself next to walls to bait your enemies into getting stunned by your ultimate.
EnemyAdvice: Gnar's animations and resource bar change as he gets closer to transforming.

AllyAdvice: Know your strengths! Mini Gnar is fast, squishy, and has high sustained damage. Mega Gnar is slow, tough, and has high burst.
EnemyAdvice: Gnar's ultimate stuns if he hits you into a wall. Be careful when fighting him near one.

AllyAdvice: Picking up goo chunks is very important to staying alive.
EnemyAdvice: Zac heals from the goo that separates from him. You can crush the goo pieces by stepping on them.

AllyAdvice: When Cell Division is ready, try to die in a position that makes it difficult for the enemy team to kill your bloblets.
EnemyAdvice: Kill all of Zac's bloblets when he splits apart to stop him from reforming.

AllyAdvice: Charging Elastic Slingshot from the fog of war will give opponents less time to react.
EnemyAdvice: Silences, stuns, roots and knockups will all interrupt Zac when he is charging Elastic Slingshot.

AllyAdvice: Dash through a minion to have Sweeping Blade available to chase your opponent should they flee; Dash directly to your opponent to preserve a minion as your escape route.
EnemyAdvice: Steel Tempest is very narrow. Dodge laterally if possible.

AllyAdvice: At level 18, Yasuo's Steel Tempest reaches its Attack Speed cap with 55% Attack Speed from items.
EnemyAdvice: When Yasuo lands two Steel Tempests in a row, his next will fire a tornado. Watch and listen for the associated sound to prepare to dodge.

AllyAdvice: Last Breath can be cast on any target that is knocked Airborne, even by one of your allies.
EnemyAdvice: Yasuo is at his weakest just after he has launched a whirlwind. Engage at that point.
Yasuo's shield from Resolve lasts only 2 seconds. Dealing damage to him will trigger it. Wait it out, then engage.

AllyAdvice: When laning, use Void Rift to kill minions while building stacks of Organic Deconstruction on your opponent. You can then follow up with your other abilities.
EnemyAdvice: Vel'Koz is very dangerous if left alone in a fight. Try to focus him down early.

AllyAdvice: Shooting Plasma Fission diagonally and splitting at maximum range allows you to hit opponents that are out of the range of the initial missile, but is more challenging to pull off.
EnemyAdvice: Vel'Koz has fairly low mobility and is vulnerable to ganks.

AllyAdvice: Be very careful about when to use Life Form Disintegration Ray. Many champions have abilities that can interrupt the spell.
EnemyAdvice: Life Form Disintegration Ray can be interrupted by stuns, silences and knockups.

AllyAdvice: Try to throw enemies into Unraveled Earth using Seismic Shove.
EnemyAdvice: When Taliyah casts Unraveled Earth in the lane, be on the lookout for Seismic Shove. If she throws you into her minefield, the throws and stones will break your bones.

AllyAdvice: Remember, you don't always have to ride Weaver's Wall.
EnemyAdvice: Taliyah's Threaded Volley is locked into a direction. If she's throwing rocks at you, dodge to the side!

AllyAdvice: Once you have Rylai's Crystal Scepter, casting Threaded Volley at enemies chasing you is a great way of making them regret everything.
Try waiting until the other team is distracted with fighting your team, and use Hookshot to pick off vulnerable targets.
EnemyAdvice: Camille's shield only works against one damage type, so hit her when she's vulnerable to your damage.

AllyAdvice: Use the CC from your abilities to land both of your Precision Protocol attacks on enemies.
EnemyAdvice: The Hextech Ultimatum has a very short range to cast, so try to flash away from her before she gets close.

AllyAdvice: Work with your allies to stack Concussive Blows, encourage them to basic attack marked targets.
EnemyAdvice: Braum must land Winter's Bite or a basic attack to start Concussive Blows. If you get marked, exit combat range before getting hit 3 more times to avoid the stun.

AllyAdvice: Leap in front of squishy friends and shield them from projectiles with Unbreakable.
EnemyAdvice: Braum's ultimate has a long cast time, use that extra time to dodge. Walking over the frozen ground left behind will slow you, position so that you don't need to cross it.

AllyAdvice: Glacial Fissure leaves a powerful slow zone, position it well to split teamfights and slow the enemy approach.
EnemyAdvice: Unbreakable gives Braum extremely strong directional defense, either wait until it is down or outposition the ability.

AllyAdvice: Deadly Flourish has incredible range. When approaching a fight be sure to look ahead for enemies that could be rooted.
EnemyAdvice: Deadly Flourish only roots those hit by one of Jhin's basic attacks, traps, or allies within the last 4 seconds.

AllyAdvice: Your ultimate deals significantly less damage to enemies with full health. Look to pick off weakened targets as they run away.
EnemyAdvice: Jhin places invisible traps around the map. Watch where you step!

AllyAdvice: You can still cast your spells while reloading. Use them to fill the down time.
EnemyAdvice: Jhin's attacks are quite potent, but he runs out of ammo after the 4th shot. Use this window to jump him and burst him down.

AllyAdvice: Moving around between attacks while jungling will help you avoid damage and also generate more heals from Wolf's Frenzy.
EnemyAdvice: Kindred is fragile - turn the pressure up on her, and she will be forced to play cautiously.

AllyAdvice: Pick which Hunts you want to pursue carefully; getting many of them is the key to success as the game goes on.
EnemyAdvice: Clear the Hunts Wolf activates on jungle camps to slow down Kindred's damage output.

AllyAdvice: Don't go in first to a large team fight. Wait for your teammates to initiate.
EnemyAdvice: When Kindred uses Lamb's Respite get inside, it stops all champions from dying.

AllyAdvice: Rockets aren't always the best choice! Jinx's minigun is incredibly powerful when fully ramped up. Switch to it whenever an enemy champion gets too close.
EnemyAdvice: Jinx's minigun takes time to ramp up. If you see her poking with rockets try to jump on her and burst her down.
