AllyAdvice: Jinx's rockets deal full damage to all enemies in the explosion. Use them on minions in lane to hit nearby enemy champions without drawing minion aggro.
EnemyAdvice: Jinx's ultimate does less damage the closer you are to her.

AllyAdvice: When a fight starts try to stay on the edge of fray by poking with rockets and Zap!. Do not run in and unload with the minigun until you feel it is safe.
EnemyAdvice: Jinx's snare grenades have a long cooldown and are her primary means of protecting herself. If she misses with them she will have a hard time escaping if engaged upon.

AllyAdvice: Your most important function as a support is to keep fragile allies safe. Keep Devour's range and cooldown in mind and position accordingly!
EnemyAdvice: When you see Tahm Kench use the shield from Thick Skin, remember that he just opted out of a good deal of healing. He will also not accumulate new gray health until Thick Skin comes off cooldown. Use this to your advantage!

AllyAdvice: Consider carefully when to use Thick Skin's active. Sometimes shielding early to avoid further damage is good, but sometimes the healing is more beneficial.
EnemyAdvice: If Tahm Kench harasses you by spitting minions at you, try going in for a trade right after he spits. His Devour will be on cooldown and you should be able to trade favourably if he can't eat you.

AllyAdvice: For optimal burst, try to combine Relentless Pursuit into Piercing Light.
EnemyAdvice: Lucian has strong burst, but little sustained damage.

AllyAdvice: Ardent Blaze actually explodes in a star pattern. Try to line it up so the spokes hit enemy champions.
EnemyAdvice: Lucian cannot change the aim of The Culling. Take advantage of this by avoiding the angle of the bullets.

AllyAdvice: Once you have chosen an angle for The Culling, you cannot change it. Pick your moment well!
EnemyAdvice: Piercing Light does not give Lucian extra Attack Range. He still needs to find a target in range to line up his shot. Avoid Piercing Light by anticipating the angle Lucian will choose.

AllyAdvice: Because of Lightslinger, Lucian benefits more from Attack Damage than he does from Attack Speed.
Saving energy and spell cooldowns until you use your ultimate will maximize Death Mark's damage.
EnemyAdvice: Zed receives bonus effect from Attack Damage items he purchases, so Armor is super effective against him.

AllyAdvice: Quickly double tapping Living Shadow will teleport Zed to his shadow immediately for rapid escapes.
EnemyAdvice: After Zed uses his Living Shadow, he is at his most vulnerable as his damage, slow, and mobility are both dependent upon it.

AllyAdvice: Placing a Living Shadow before using Death Mark can give Zed a safe escape from combat.
EnemyAdvice: Zed's Shadow Slash can only slow you if his shadow hits you with it.

AllyAdvice: Kled generates some courage by killing minions, but gets much more from fighting Champions.
EnemyAdvice: Kled generates courage by damaging enemies with his Pocket Pistol and basic attacks, killing minions, and attacking structures or epic monsters.

AllyAdvice: The last hit of Violent Tendencies deals more damage than the first three - make sure you hit it!
EnemyAdvice: Watch Kled's courage bar when he's off his mount - when it reaches 100%, he will remount and regain a significant amount of health.

AllyAdvice: Chaaaaaaaarge!!! can be cast at a great range. Try and predict where the enemy team will be by the time you reach them.
EnemyAdvice: Kled is much more threatening when he has Violent Tendencies ready.

AllyAdvice: Chronobreak is a potent escape tool, but it can also be quite powerful when used offensively. Don't underestimate its damage potential.
EnemyAdvice: Ekko is significantly weaker when his ultimate is down. Watch for the trail he leaves behind to determine if Chronobreak is available.

AllyAdvice: If you can proc Z-Drive Resonance on an enemy champion, it's worth taking risks to do so. The bonus movement speed makes it easy to escape.
EnemyAdvice: Ekko's stun zone takes 3 seconds to arm. Watch for the image he creates on cast and try to guess where the zone was placed.

AllyAdvice: Phase Dive's dash is a great tool for setting up Ekko's other abilities. Use it to get double hits with Timewinder or get into position to detonate Parallel Convergence.
EnemyAdvice: The second hit of Timewinder does more damage than the first; try to avoid it.

AllyAdvice: A fully charged Vault Breaker will deal double damage. It's great for catching and finishing off fleeing enemies.
EnemyAdvice: A fully charged Vault breaker deals double damage. If you see Vi start to charge you should back off or try to dodge it.

AllyAdvice: Excessive Force does full damage to anyone caught in the shockwave. Use it on minions in lane to hit enemies hiding behind them.
EnemyAdvice: Vi will shred your Armor and gain Attack Speed if she manages to hit you three times in a row. Try not to engage in extended brawls with her.

AllyAdvice: Assault and Battery is a powerful initiation tool, just remember not to get too far ahead of the rest of your team.
EnemyAdvice: Vi cannot be stopped while using her ult. Remember to save your displacement effects until after she's done charging.

AllyAdvice: Use Umbral Dash while casting The Darkin Blade to increase your chances of hitting the enemy.
EnemyAdvice: Aatrox's attacks are very telegraphed, so use the time to dodge the hit zones.

AllyAdvice: Crowd Control abilities like Infernal Chains or your allies' immobilizing effects will help you set up The Darkin Blade.
EnemyAdvice: Aatrox's Infernal Chains are easier to exit when running towards the sides or at Aatrox.

AllyAdvice: Cast World Ender when you are sure you can force a fight.
EnemyAdvice: Keep your distance when Aatrox uses his Ultimate to prevent him from reviving.

AllyAdvice: Aqua Prison has a long cooldown, make sure to use it at the right moment.
EnemyAdvice: Aqua Prison is a very powerful ability with a long cooldown, take advantage of the situation if Nami misses this ability.

AllyAdvice: Using Ebb and Flow during an engagement with enemy champions will help sway the battle in your favor.
EnemyAdvice: Tidal Wave has a very long range but travels slowly, be aware of when it is coming your way as you can move out of its path.

AllyAdvice: Nami's ultimate can come in very handy for initiating on enemies who are far away.
EnemyAdvice: Try to avoid fighting an opponent affected by Tidecaller's Blessing, it lasts a short duration so waiting it out can help you greatly.

AllyAdvice: Be careful about putting down both of the soldiers stored by Arise! Unless you're going all-in, always have a soldier in your back pocket if you need to escape over a wall or if you misposition your other soldier and need damage now.
EnemyAdvice: Azir relies on his soldiers to deal damage and can only move them so often. Try to capitalize on windows of time when his soldiers are stationary.

AllyAdvice: In the lane, try to position your soldiers between the enemy's minions and the enemy champion. This way you can use them both to last hit and to project threat onto your lane opponent.
EnemyAdvice: Azir has immense damage over a prolonged amount of time but lacks the upfront burst of other mages. Try to burst him out before he can turn a confrontation around.

AllyAdvice: Think of Emperor's Divide as a defensive ability first and foremost. Use it when the enemy engages on you or your allies. Remember that your team can walk through the soldiers summoned by Emperor's Divide and use this to your advantage when enemy melee champions engage on you.
EnemyAdvice: Try to think of Sand Soldiers as fire. Don't stand in the fire.

AllyAdvice: Be a bird!
Communication is key when making use of Thresh's lantern. Let your teammates know how you like to use it.
EnemyAdvice: Thresh's Death Sentence has a long cast time. Watch for the cast to begin to take evasive actions.

AllyAdvice: Death Sentence and Flay can be combined in either cast order for powerful combinations.
EnemyAdvice: Intentionally breaking a wall of The Box can allow a vulnerable ally to escape unscathed.

AllyAdvice: Thresh can collect souls without needing to kill units himself. Planning your map position to be near the most deaths will help to maximize soul collection.
EnemyAdvice: Thresh relies on collecting souls for a portion of his defense and damage. Try punishing him when he moves to collect them.

AllyAdvice: Tentacles are an immense source of power. Don't fight without them.
EnemyAdvice: Killing Tentacles whenever possible will make it much easier to win a fight against Illaoi.

AllyAdvice: Spirits inherit their target's current health. If making a Vessel  is your goal, try whittling your opponent's health down a bit first to make killing the spirit easier.
EnemyAdvice: When your spirit gets pulled out, fight back if you can. Dealing damage to Illaoi reduces the spirit's duration.

AllyAdvice: Leap of Faith is best used to follow-up a strong engage or when being engaged upon. Be careful about being the first one into a fight.
EnemyAdvice: Avoid grouping up for Leap of Faith to reduce the number of Tentacles available to Illaoi.

AllyAdvice: Keeping tunnels spread out across the map will ensure you have choices when you want to cast Void Rush.
EnemyAdvice: If you see one of Rek'Sai's tunnels, briefly stand on one of the entrances to destroy it.

AllyAdvice: Cast Burrow before travelling around the map to take advantage of the increased Movement Speed and the safety provided by Tremor Sense.
EnemyAdvice: Rek'Sai's Furious Bite gains damage as she builds Fury. Be very careful around her when her Fury is full.

AllyAdvice: Tremor Sense can warn you of enemies closing in, and is particularly useful when entering enemy territory.
EnemyAdvice: When Rek'Sai is near, she can see the position of you and your allies, but only if you're moving.

AllyAdvice: Try to help allies follow up a good Rootcaller hit with Triggerseed!
EnemyAdvice: Ivern can be deceptively slippery. Be careful chasing him too far.

AllyAdvice: Use Brushmaker to set up future ambush spots!
EnemyAdvice: Ivern's brush has a long duration. Watch out for ambushes!

AllyAdvice: Daisy can block skillshots and slow down enemies. Use her to peel for your teammates!
EnemyAdvice: Be careful when fighting Ivern alone if he has Daisy ready to help!

AllyAdvice: Rend is a valuable last hitting aid, since its cooldown resets if it kills a target.
EnemyAdvice: Kalista's mobility is dependent upon attacking. This means it is low when she is outside of her attack range and that Attack Speed slows reduce the amount of distance she can cover in an engagement.

AllyAdvice: Entering a move order once to trigger Martial Poise will not clear Kalista's basic attack target.
EnemyAdvice: Kalista cannot cancel her basic attack wind up. While she is very mobile, this offers a window to land spells on her if you anticipate when she will begin attacking.

AllyAdvice: Due to her passive, Kalista's Movement Speed is effectively increased by Attack Speed.
EnemyAdvice: If you can break line of sight from Kalista, including through brush, her basic attacks will miss you, falling harmlessly to the ground.

AllyAdvice: It's important to collect chimes to improve your meep's attacks, but don't neglect your lane partner! Try to make a big entrance by bringing an ally into the lane with you with Magical Journey.
EnemyAdvice: Bard's opponents can also travel through his Magical Journey doorways. You can follow him, if you think it's safe.

AllyAdvice: Let your Caretaker's Shrines charge up - they heal for a lot more when at full power.
EnemyAdvice: You can crush Bard's healing shrines just by walking over them. Don't let his allies take them without a fight.

AllyAdvice: Don't forget that enemies can also use your Magical Journey doorways, and that your ultimate can also hit your allies!
EnemyAdvice: Bard's ultimate, Tempered Fate, affects allies, enemies, monsters, and turrets alike. Sometimes it can be to your advantage to jump into it!

AllyAdvice: Rakan requires allies near him to make the most out of his tools.
EnemyAdvice: Rakan's movement abilities forecast their destination. Try to use this to your advantage.

AllyAdvice: Rakan's dash speeds increase with his movement speed. Use the extra speed to surprise your enemies!
EnemyAdvice: Champions with crowd control that can be applied quickly excel against Rakan.

AllyAdvice: Danger is as fun as you let it be.
EnemyAdvice: Catching Rakan with no allies around severely inhibits his mobility. Try to find him alone.

AllyAdvice: Xayah's attacks and abilities leave Feathers on the ground that she can later recall for massive area damage and control.
EnemyAdvice: Xayah's Bladecaller will only root targets hit by 3 or more returning Feathers.

AllyAdvice: Xayah can use Featherstorm to dodge almost any ability while also creating a ton of Feathers. Try to utilize the offensive and defensive aspects of this ability.
EnemyAdvice: Long fights in the same area with Xayah will allow her to drop a lot of Feathers. Try to stay on the move!
Make sure you are ready when you go for the kill. Untargetability from Featherstorm can quickly turn an ambush in Xayah's favor.

AllyAdvice: Learning build paths of items can help quickly select upgrades in lane.
EnemyAdvice: Try to stay away from walls. Ornn is much less strong if he cannot stun you.

AllyAdvice: Volcanic Rupture can be used to set up zoning areas to threaten enemies.
EnemyAdvice: Attack Ornn to keep him from creating items in lane.

AllyAdvice: The order of your abilties matters! Try to optimize Brittle usage.
Wait for you or your enemy to reach low health before using Kingslayer for maximum effect.
EnemyAdvice: Sylas's healthbar can be deceptive, watch out for his Kingslayer!

AllyAdvice: Space out your ability usage to get maximum effect from Petricite Burst.
EnemyAdvice: Try to fight Sylas when he isn't able to take your ultimate.

AllyAdvice: Clever use of enemy ultimates can open up new possibilities to approach teamfights.
You can set her passive to use hotkeys in the options menu. The default is Shift+F1~F5
EnemyAdvice: Standing behind minions against Neeko is very dangerous as Tangle-Barbs become stronger.

AllyAdvice: Try to use Inherent Glamour sparingly, ineffective uses will put enemies on the alert.
EnemyAdvice: Pop Blossom's warning visuals are invisible if Neeko is disguised.

AllyAdvice: Each of Aphelios' weapons have different strengths, so try to find the right situation for your current weapons.
EnemyAdvice: Each of Aphelios' weapons have different weaknesses, try to exploit the ones that work best for your champion. Watch out for the purple Gravity gun, it can root you.

AllyAdvice: Pyke is very fragile so don't be afraid to temporarily run from a fight. You can regenerate a significant amount of health from Gift of the Drowned Ones when enemies can't see you.
EnemyAdvice: Pyke regenerates a significant amount of damage he has taken from enemy champions, but only when you can't see him!

AllyAdvice: Hitting an enemy with the Hold version of Bone Skewer will always pull them the same distance. Use it in melee range to throw targets behind you.
EnemyAdvice: When Pyke is hidden nearby in his Ghostwater Dive, sharks will circle underneath your feet.

AllyAdvice: The Tap version of Bone Skewer is much faster and deals additional damage.
EnemyAdvice: Try not to stand near low health allies. If Pyke executes them using Death From Below, you might be next on the list.

AllyAdvice: A lot of your agressive spells are also your escapes. Make sure you always have a plan to get out of the fight.
